page.title: 02Medstead Primary School
page.content:
Medstead Primary School is a four class primary school with 100-120 children aged 5 to 11 years. It is situated in a new building on the edge of the village.
It is a pioneer in the use of computers in education. The school has eight computers, five IBM PCs and three BBC computers.
Medstead School was the first primary school in the country to be linked to the Times Network for schools, an electronic database and mailing system.
The school is used as an In-service training centre and "centre of excellence". Videos of the school are used by Hampshire, IBM and the Department of Trade and Industry.
